Filter and Effects

Todo: This chapter is not complete yet
This example runs way too slow, because the filters are constantly re-render and re-evaluated. Once this is fixed, this example should run at interactive speeds again.

FloatCanvas provides filters which you can use to achieve special effects.

There are some builtin filters like a drop shadow, 3d look, glow and pixelize filter but you are free (and encouraged) to write some of your own.

Filters simply take a rendered surface of the node, perform some transformation on the pixel data and then can draw this pixel data in addition to the node.

Also checkout the pie-chart example, it makes use of filters to render shadows for the text and button and a 3D effect to make the pie-chart look more plastic
